metadata.Title: CVE-2018-12387 on Ubuntu 20.04 ESM (focal) - medium.
metadata.Description:
A vulnerability where the JavaScript JIT compiler inlines Array.prototype.push with multiple arguments that results in the stack pointer being off by 8 bytes after a bailout. This leaks a memory address to the calling function which can be used as part of an exploit inside the sandboxed content process. This vulnerability affects Firefox ESR < 60.2.2 and Firefox < 62.0.3.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-12387` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 62.0.3+build1-0ubuntu1
firefox-geckodriver - 62.0.3+build1-0ubuntu1
firefox-mozsymbols - 62.0.3+build1-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

thunderbird - 1:60.4.0+build2-0ubuntu1
thunderbird-gnome-support - 1:60.4.0+build2-0ubuntu1
thunderbird-mozsymbols - 1:60.4.0+build2-0ubuntu1
xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 1:60.4.0+build2-0ubuntu1
xul-ext-gdata-provider - 1:60.4.0+build2-0ubuntu1
xul-ext-lightning - 1:60.4.0+build2-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

notes.Note: tyhicks> mozjs contains a copy of the SpiderMonkey JavaScript engine

criterions.comment: firefox package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '62.0.3+build1-0ubuntu1').
mozjs52 package in focal is affected and may need fixing.
thunderbird package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:60.4.0+build2-0ubuntu1').
